result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey M. SCHERER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in.  Defendant plead to charges in 15 CF 668, 15 CF 669 and 15 CF 670.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Plea date on June 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Order Reducing Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the cash bail of $1,000.00 shall be reduced to $500.00 cash. All other conditions of bond remain in full force and effect.
Cover letter.
Copy to jail.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.

Attorney Engstrom is requesting the cash bail set in each case be converted to signature bonds.  Defendant would also be willing to have a condition of a daily report date.
State objects to the request and presents arguments.
Court believes cash bail is appropriate and modifies the $1,000.00 cash bonds in 15 CF 667 and 15 CF 668 to $500.00 cash and continues the $500.00 cash bond in 15 CF 669.  Conditions remain the same.
Attorney Engstrom is directed to prepare the Order.
Minutes.
Motion hearing at 03-31-2016 03:00 pm
Motion hearing at 03-22-2016 09:30 am

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-10-2016 @ 1:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
It is hereby ordered that Brian D. Van Ells shall be allowed to withdraw as counsel for the defendant in the above-entitled action due to a conflict of interest pursuant to SCR 20:1.7.
Preliminary hearing at 02-10-2016 01:30 pm
Scott Engstrom, through Public Defender.
Petition to Withdraw as Counsel of Record.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.

to withdraw as counsel of record. Granted.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.
Attorney Larson moves court to withdraw as attorney of record. Motion Granted.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. New date for preliminary hearing to be scheduled when new counsel is appointed.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 12-09-15 at 9:30 a.m.    
Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Fail to report to jail, on 11-06-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of fail to report to jail.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Harold G. Toms, Nathan C. Korinek or 2314 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI and Judith A. Engelbrecht or 910 S. 39th Street, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
